paragraphs.text: My name is Diarmaid de Burca, and I was born in Dublin, Ireland, on the 3rd of July, 1988.
I did my undergraduate degree in Physics and Applied Mathematics, completing it with a First Class Honours in 2010.
I then worked on simulating emission from pulsars - completing my Doctorate in the study of Incoherent Synchrotron Radiation in High Magnetic Fields in September 2015.
Upon finishing my doctorate, I moved to Edinburgh, where I worked on simulating animal breeding populations at the Roslin Institue
After working in Edinburgh for 18 months, I moved to Berlin, where I have been working as a backend developer at Makersite.
I am interested in Fortran, Python and React development.

I started my journey into computer science with Fortran, when I was simulating emission from isolated neutron stars.   I inherited a embarressingly parallel simulation code which was written in Fortran90, and parallelised using MPI. Over the course of my PhD, I learnt (through necessity) how to program in Fortran 90, and how to program in parallel. Upon completion of my PhD, I knew that I did not want to remain in the field of astronomy. As such, I got a position where I was doing software development using Fortran.
